class framed.core.cbmodel.CBModel(model_id)¶

Bases: framed.core.model.Model

add_gene(gene)¶

Add a gene metabolite to the model. If a gene with the same id exists, it will be replaced.

Parameters:gene – Gene
add_ratio_constraint(r_id_num, r_id_den, ratio)¶

Add a flux ratio constraint to the model.

Parameters:
  • r_id_num – str – id of the numerator
  • r_id_num – str – id of the denominator
  • ratio – float – ratio value
Returns:

identifier of the pseudo-metabolite
Return type:

str
add_reaction(reaction, lb=None, ub=None, coeff=0)¶

Add a single reaction to the model. If a reaction with the same id exists, it will be replaced.

Parameters:
  • reaction – Reaction
  • lb – float – lower bound (default: None)
  • ub – float – upper bound (default: None)
  • coeff – float – objective coefficient (default: 0)

Detects biomass reaction in the model (searches by objective coefficient)

Returns:str – first reaction that matches (or else None)

set_flux_bounds(r_id, lb, ub)¶

Define flux bounds for one reaction

Parameters:
  • r_id – str – reaction id
  • lb – float – lower bound (use None to represent negative infinity)
  • ub – float – upper bound (use None to represent positive infinity)

framed.core.fixes module¶

Fixes to clean up common models from different sources/groups.

@author: Daniel Machado

framed.core.fixes.clean_bigg_ids(model)¶
framed.core.fixes.clean_bounds(model, threshold=1000)¶

Remove artificially large bounds (unbounded = no bounds).

framed.core.fixes.default_fixes(model)¶
framed.core.fixes.fix_cb_model(model, flavor=None)¶

framed.core.fixes.fix_reversibility(model)¶

Make reaction reversibility consistent with the bounds.

framed.core.fixes.remove_boundary_metabolites(model, tag=None)¶

Remove remove boundary metabolites.

framed.core.model module¶

This module defines base classes for metabolic modeling.

@author: Daniel Machado

class framed.core.model.Compartment(elem_id, name=None, size=1.0)¶

Base class for modeling compartments.

class framed.core.model.Metabolite(elem_id, name=None, compartment=None, boundary=False)¶

Base class for modeling metabolites.

class framed.core.model.Model(model_id)¶

Base class for all metabolic models implemented as a bipartite network. Contains the list of metabolites, reactions, compartments, and stoichiometry.

add_compartment(compartment)¶

Add a single compartment to the model. If a compartment with the same id exists, it will be replaced.

Parameters:compartment – Compartment
add_metabolite(metabolite)¶

Add a single metabolite to the model. If a metabolite with the same id exists, it will be replaced. If the metabolite compartment is defined, then it must exist in the model.

Parameters:metabolite – Metabolite
add_reaction(reaction)¶

Add a single reaction to the model. If a reaction with the same id exists, it will be replaced.

Parameters:reaction – Reaction
add_reaction_activator(r_id, m_id)¶
add_reaction_inhibitor(r_id, m_id)¶
add_reaction_regulator(r_id, m_id, kind='?')¶

get_activation_targets(m_id)¶
get_inhibition_targets(m_id)¶
get_metabolite_sinks(m_id)¶

Return the list of output reactions for one metabolite

Parameters:m_id – str – metabolite id
Returns:list [of str] – output reactions list
get_metabolite_sources(m_id)¶

Return the list of input reactions for one metabolite

Parameters:m_id – str – metabolite id
Returns:list [of str] – input reactions list
get_reaction_compartments(r_id)¶
get_stoichiometry(m_id, r_id)¶
metabolite_reaction_lookup_table()¶

Return the network topology as a nested map: metabolite id -> reaction id -> coefficient

Returns:OrderedDict (of str to OrderedDict of str to float) – lookup table
print_reaction(r_id, reaction_names=False, metabolite_names=False)¶

Print a reaction to a text based representation.

Parameters:
  • r_id – str – reaction id
  • reaction_names – bool – print reaction names instead of ids (default: False)
  • metabolite_names – bool – print metabolite names instead of ids (default: False)
Returns:

str – reaction string

  • delete_reactions – Bool – False (default)

Remove a compartment from the model.

Parameters:
  • c_ids – list of str – compartment ids
  • delete_metabolites – Bool – True (default)
  • delete_reactions – Bool – False (default)
remove_metabolite(m_id)¶

Remove a single metabolite from the model. Also removes all the edges connected to the metabolite.

Parameters:m_id – str – metabolite id
remove_metabolites(id_list)¶

Remove a list of metabolites from the model. Also removes all the edges connected to the metabolites.

Parameters:id_list – list of str – metabolite ids
remove_reaction(r_id)¶

Remove a single reaction from the model. Also removes all the edges connected to the reaction.

Parameters:r_id – str – reaction id
remove_reactions(id_list)¶

Remove a list of reactions from the model. Also removes all the edges connected to the reactions.

Parameters:id_list – list of str – reaction ids

stoichiometric_matrix()¶

Return the full stoichiometric matrix represented by the network topology

Returns:list (of list of float) – stoichiometric matrix
to_string(reaction_names=False, metabolite_names=False)¶

Print the model to a text based representation.

Returns:str – model string

framed.core.transformation module¶

Module for model transformation operations.

@author: Daniel Machado

framed.core.transformation.disconnected_genes(model)¶
framed.core.transformation.disconnected_metabolites(model)¶
framed.core.transformation.make_irreversible(model)¶

Splits all reversible reactions into forward and backward directions. For efficiency the given model is converted. To keep a copy use deepcopy first.

Parameters:model – Model (or CBmodel)
Returns:dictionary – mapping of old reaction ids to splitted reaction ids
Return type:str to (str, str
framed.core.transformation.simplify(model)¶

Removes all blocked reactions in a constraint based model

Parameters:model – CBModel
Returns:(list – lists of removed reactions, metabolites, and genes
Return type:of str

Module contents¶

Package implementing the core features for building and manipulating metabolic models.

@author: Daniel Machado

Copyright 2013 Novo Nordisk Foundation Center for Biosustainability, Technical University of Denmark.
